intro: Serrafalcus neglectus, commonly known as the neglected serrated fern, is a unique species belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its finely serrated leaf margins and a compact, upright growth habit. Native to tropical regions, this plant thrives in humid, shaded environments with well-drained soil. Its fronds are typically dark green and exhibit a delicate, lace-like appearance. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, Serrafalcus neglectus is often found in specialized botanical collections.
